On Thursday at the Conservative Political Action Conference, Conway ‚Äï a woman whose career has greatly benefited from the work feminists have done ‚Äï said that she is ‚Äúnot about‚Äù identifying as a feminist . But Conway seems to be a bit confused about what the word actually means. 
‚ÄúFor me, it‚Äôs difficult to call myself a feminist in the classic sense because it seems to be very anti-male,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúAnd it certainly is very pro-abortion in this context. And I‚Äôm not anti-male or pro-abortion.‚Äù 
However, Merriam-Webster was quick to rectify her misunderstanding. The dictionary tweeted the following on Thursday afternoon: üìà'Feminism' is defined as "the belief that men and women should have equal rights and opportunities." https://t.co/Zjf7CAPUjL 
Feminism, the tweet reads, is: ‚Äúthe belief that men and women should have equal rights and opportunities.‚Äù 
Boom. I‚Äôm just a woman and I love being a woman," she said.
